misconceptions.inferred_category_name: Correct Bubble Sort Implementation with Parallel Array Synchronization
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that to sort parallel arrays by one array's values, you must swap elements in both arrays simultaneously during the bubble sort process. When comparing scores (t[j] > t[j+1]), both the score and corresponding name must be swapped together to maintain the relationship between the two arrays.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: There is no conceptual gap here. The student has correctly understood that parallel arrays require synchronized swaps. The code properly implements bubble sort with both arrays being swapped in tandem, maintaining the invariant that s[i] and t[i] always represent the same student throughout the sorting process.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: No error - the code produces correct output

misconceptions.inferred_category_name: Correct Identification of Maximum Element After Sorting
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that after sorting in ascending order, the largest element will be at the end of the array (index n-1). Therefore, to find the top student, access s[n-1] and t[n-1].
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: There is no conceptual gap. This is the correct understanding: ascending sort places the maximum value at the rightmost position.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: No error - the code produces correct output
